name: places/ChIJ81Hnc4RZwokRfWWztzfiGu0
formattedAddress: 151 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 151 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA

editorialSummary.text: Stylish boutique property offering modern rooms & a guest-only rooftop deck.

originalText.text: I stayed at the Ridge with 2 friends of mine during the past Christmas holiday. They gave us a triple room which was really small. We literally had to do acrobatics in order to open our luggages and we found that quite annoying. Moreover, they never cleaned our room during our stay, which is very unhygienic since we stayed there 10 days (apparently, you have to pay a $35 fee if you want your room to be cleaned). However, the most unpleasant inconvenience we had while staying there was when our room door was blocked and we couldn't open it. It happened around 11 pm and there was no one at the reception! We tried to contact them multiple times (phone + email) but they never replied. Fortunately, some customers who had a similar problem were able to contact the assistance and we finally got a new code for our door. We waited more than 2 hours before being able to enter our room and I find that shameful! If it was possible, I would rate the customer service 0/10! Overall, I wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel. The only positive thing about it is the location, which is perfect to reach both the city center and the Brooklyn (the metro is really close to the hotel).

originalText.text:
Location is great you’re in the middle of everything F train is less than a block away and there’s a bunch of restaurants and shops in the vicinity.

Hotel is more or less and AirBNB. No cleaning and front desk is only there at set hours but other than that it’s a great deal. All extra toiletries and towels that you need are available 24/7 although there isn’t anyone at the desks. The rooms were plenty warm and have a pretty big bathroom for the size of the room. Also there’s a bonus rooftop with amazing views.

originalText.text: We stayed at the Ridge for 6 nights two people and it was very nice. A small room with a space for a bed and a fridge, which is what you need really. Every hotel in New York is expensive, but we think we got what we paid for: a nice/regular room with a great location and view. I rated service 1/5 because we didn’t have any encounter with staff, so service is not really present nor not-present ? Only negative is that the room wasn’t cleaned at all during our stay. It would have been nice with just one cleaning and changing of towels etc.

originalText.text:
Stay away from room 101. This room is in the lobby and is super loud. Should be offered at a discount rate.
Rooftop meeting place is lovely and the basement common area make group travel easier. Staff were wonderful!
Rooms themselves are clean and updated. Fridge and micro were included.
Good location and close to subway etc.

originalText.text:
Couldn't check in when I got here.
Lack of initiative. On their part.
Had to call in order to get into my room.
No staff when checking in.
Black mold on bathtub caulking.
Black hair on my towel when I got here. Ceiling fan doesn't work. Bathroom ceiling is caving in.

Rust in the bathtub. No toilet paper holder.
Cheap and dusty storage cupboards.
No parking.
No ice or ice buckets.
Bed had no box spring. Cheapest worst bed I have ever slept on.
"Smart TV" is not a smart TV at all unless you bring your own Firestick.
Shower door leaks when fully closed.
Walls are paper thin and very easy to hear guests next door.
There is very limited plugs for charging.
Overpriced for such a ridiculously small room.

Heat was off and it took multiple guests complaining to get it turned on.

3/10 because the gentlemen who was working desk at night on Sunday was an absolute delight. You guys are lucky to have him.

This hotel is purely profit driven and it is not a good look.

Do not come here unless you want a small room and no service.
